qas.question: what is the acronym for the East india company?
In 1750 how many regular troops did the  EIC  have?
in 1778 most of the troops that the EIC had were from where?
what year did the EIC have 26,000 troops in their employ
What is no longer the acronym for the East India company?
How many special troops did the EIC exile in 1750?
Who were most of the troops that the EIC hid in 1778?
What year did the EIC lose 26,000 troops in one day?

context: In its first century and half, the <a0_0><b4_0>EIC<b4_0/><a0_0/> used a few hundred soldiers as guards. The great expansion came after 1750, when it had <a1_0><b5_0>3000<b5_0/><a1_0/> regular troops. By <a3_0><b7_0>1763<b7_0/><a3_0/>, it had 26,000; by 1778, it had 67,000. It recruited largely <a2_0><b6_0>Indian<b6_0/><a2_0/> troops, and trained them along European lines. The company, fresh from a colossal victory, and with the backing of its own private well-disciplined and experienced army, was able to assert its interests in the Carnatic region from its base at Madras and in Bengal from Calcutta, without facing any further obstacles from other colonial powers.
